New Records: Zack Wheeler earned his 100th career victory
Key Match Events: Edmundo Sosa homered, doubled, and drove in two runs
Trea Turner also went deep for NL East-leading Philadelphia
Michael Harris II robbed Austin Hays of a home run with a stellar, highlight-reel catch in the seventh inning
Pre-Game Insights: Phillies manager Rob Thomson said of Wheeler: 'He was locked in tonight.'
Atlanta manager Brian Snitker said of Harris' catch: 'That’s probably the catch of the year.'
Post-Match Reflections: Wheeler said of his 100th victory: 'It’s special. It’s been a long road. Hard work and just believing in myself and believing in the teams I’ve been on. Just trying to work hard and continue that and just get wins.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies have won six of eight and increased their lead over the Braves in the division to six games.
The lead should have been greater had Harris not snared Hays’ drive to center leading off the seventh.
Others: Jeff Hoffman struck out two in a scoreless eighth and Carlos Estévez completed the shutout with his 23rd save in 27 tries and third in four chances since being acquired by the Phillies on July 27.
